title: I LOVE LISTS
description: I LOVE LISTS Lion steals camera lens. Hotels are doing things differently. I want to eat my way through Rome again. That reminds me, I should reread my old Italy post. This adu is dreamy! Private dining rooms are all the rage in SF. I’ve never heard of red sprites. Whoa. My mom loved butter-yellow painted rooms. I would like to do this for my trinkets! Did you know Ridley Scott made commercials? Why is it called a hot dog? Ina says to get the big eggs, so I do. We are getting close to talking to dolphins now. Couples’ styles in the 1950s. Newlyweds in the 1970s. Here’s what dating ads looked like in the 1970s. Why your store-bought sushi comes with fake grass. First time at Costco? Here’s what you should buy. Weekend treat: Ricotta Pancakes with Roasted Strawberries Weekend reading: The Joy Reset + Mother Sauce If you need a boost to get re-motivated for 2025, join me next month for a Half-Year Reset Workshop. Here’s your chance to pause, reflect, and realign your routines so the rest of 2025 feels more intentional and energized. Half-Year Reset Workshop! The post I LOVE LISTS appeared first on Shutterbean.
excerpt: I Love Lists is a weekly roundup of the best links from around the internet, curated by Tracy Benjamin of Shutterbean. Discover inspiring reads, creative ideas, delicious recipes, and fun finds every week!
text: Jamie June 6, 2025 Office Manager here in the Portland, OR area, and finding a mid-size private dining venue for a company dinner is difficult. They book out fast, or we’re just slightly too big for that restaurant’s space, or waaaay to small to justify the hotel’s small ballroom. It’s a struggle every year! Reply
html:
• Jamie June 6, 2025

    Office Manager here in the Portland, OR area, and finding a mid-size private dining venue for a company dinner is difficult. They book out fast, or we’re just slightly too big for that restaurant’s space, or waaaay to small to justify the hotel’s small ballroom. It’s a struggle every year!

    Reply
